articles.author: KATE BRUMBACK
articles.description: ATLANTA (AP) — John Eastman, the conservative attorney who pushed a plan to keep Donald Trump in power, turned himself in to authorities Tuesday on charges in the Georgia case alleging an illegal plot to overturn the former president’s 2020 election loss.
articles.title: Attorney John Eastman surrenders on charges in Trump's Georgia 2020 election subversion case

articles.author: AUDREY McAVOY, GENE JOHNSON and JENNIFER SINCO KELLEHER
articles.description: LAHAINA, Hawaii (AP) — Authorities in Hawaii pleaded Tuesday with relatives of those missing after the deadliest U.S.
articles.title: Hawaii officials urge families of people missing after deadly fires to give DNA samples

articles.author: SAM MEDNICK
articles.description: NIAMEY, Niger (AP) — After three months of crossing the desert and then watching other migrants die at sea in his failed attempt to reach Europe, Sahr John Yambasu gave up on getting across the Mediterranean and decided to go back home.
articles.title: Thousands of discouraged migrants are stranded in Niger because of border closures following coup

articles.author: MARTÍN ADAMES ALCÁNTARA
articles.description: SANTO DOMINGO, Dominican Republic (AP) — Tropical Storm Franklin roared toward the island of Hispaniola shared by the Dominican Republic and Haiti early Wednesday amid fears it would trigger deadly landslides and heavy flooding in both countries.
articles.title: Tropical Storm Franklin nears Haiti and the Dominican Republic bringing fears of floods, landslides

articles.author: AARON MORRISON
articles.description: Sixty years ago, Andrew Young and his staff had just emerged from an exhausting campaign against racial segregation in Birmingham, Alabama.But they didn’t feel no ways tired, as the Black spiritual says.
articles.title: At March on Washington's 60th anniversary, leaders seek energy of original movement for civil rights

articles.author: JINTAMAS SAKSORNCHAI
articles.description: BANGKOK (AP) — Thailand's divisive former Prime Minister Thaksin Shinawatra was transferred from prison to a hospital early Wednesday, less than a day after he returned from an extended exile and started serving an 8-year sentence.
articles.title: Thaksin moved from prison to a hospital less than a day after he returned to Thailand from exile

articles.author: CHRISTOPHER SHERMAN and SONIA PÉREZ D.
articles.description: GUATEMALA CITY (AP) — Bernardo Arévalo's experience in peacebuilding and diplomacy eminently qualify him to lead Guatemala as the conflict-riven country's next president, those who know him say. But first he will have to overcome forces that could keep him from taking power.
articles.title: Allies say Guatemala election winner is a highly qualified peacebuilder, but opponent's still silent

articles.author: HALELUYA HADERO and MATT OTT
articles.description: The union representing 340,000 UPS workers said Tuesday that its members voted to approve the tentative contract agreement reached last month, putting a final seal on contentious labor negotiations that threatened to disrupt package deliveries for millions of businesses and households nationwide.
articles.title: UPS workers approve 5-year contract, capping contentious negotiations that threatened deliveries

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.description: Russian defenses downed Ukrainian drones in Moscow and the region around the capital early Wednesday, the defense ministry and the mayor said. No casualties were reported.Moscow Mayor Sergey Sobyanin said one drone fell into a building under construction in Moscow City, a prestigious business complex hit by drones twice before.
articles.title: Drones downed in Moscow and surrounding region with no casualties, Russian officials say

articles.author: YURI KAGEYAMA
articles.description: TOKYO (AP) — Kazutaka Yonekura dreams of a world where everyone will have their very own digital “clone” — an online avatar that could take on some of our work and daily tasks, such as appearing in Zoom meetings in our place.
articles.title: Digital clones and Vocaloids may be popular in Japan. Elsewhere, they could get lost in translation
